item.title: Another post
item.description: This is just another post. See how to include data inside your posts: Beatles Discography {% for album in site.data.beatles %} {{ album.Name }} (released on {{ album.Released }}) {% endfor %}

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated. To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.

item.title: About
item.description: This is a minimal Learn-Jekyll.js website. It is not meant to replace Jekyll — it just mimics some of its functionality. It might be useful for those who do not want to install Ruby & Jekyll on their computer. To use it, you need to keep a two-level file structure and describe it in mock/structure.yml. Learn more about it in its Github repo.
